you need to find the partition in /dev/ and then   sudo mount /dev/sda1    or wichever it is

sudo mount /dev/sdb3   is what you type in a terminal - do you know terminal?
unless you change something in your existing ubuntu it will stay preserved
then browse to /media/disk-5
don't worry about the name of the mount - look at the files to see if it is the right one that's mounted
you don't mount disks you mount the partitions on the disk - an important point
sudo mount /dev/sda3  or whichever it is called - you need to find it in the folder /dev
if right click says unmount then it is mounted already
it won't from the live cd
you have 3 ubuntu installs from your menu.lst - do you get none from the grub menu?
are you in the live cd now?
open a terminal and type   sudo grub
then type find /boot/grub/stage1
type   update grub
type   quit   then type     update grub
you can try to grub-install and see if it works - but you may have a hard disk issue - 'cause you do have a /boot/grub/menu.lst - so the hard disk might be on its' way out
it might be the part of the disk with the master boot record on that has trouble - hard to say from here - but seems like it is a hardware issue - maybe
